intro: Arenaria shennongjiaensis, commonly known as Shennongjia sandwort, is a rare flowering plant native to the Shennongjia Mountains in China. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing habit and small, white or pinkish flowers. The plant typically thrives in moist, shaded environments at high altitudes, often found in rocky or forested areas. Its leaves are usually narrow and grass-like, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered an endemic and endangered species.
